paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the role of the F557L mutation in the KCNH2 gene and its impact on hERG channel inhibition by various drugs. It provides functional data on the mutation's effect on drug binding and inhibition but does not provide individual-level penetrance data or clinical significance.

functional_data.summary: The F557L mutation in KCNH2 impairs hERG channel block by several drugs, showing a shift in IC50 values indicating reduced drug potency.

variants.evidence_level: Functional evidence from in vitro studies
variants.additional_notes: The F557L mutation is compared to the Y652A mutation, showing similar effects on drug inhibition.
key_quotes: Substantial shifts of the concentration response curves of F557L to the right and incomplete hERG inhibition at high concentrations compared to WT illustrates strong impairment of channel block.

tables_processed.table_caption: IC50 shifts for various hERG inhibitors with F557L and Y652A mutations

challenges: No individual-level penetrance data or clinical significance provided
extraction_metadata.notes: The paper focuses on functional assays and modeling studies rather than clinical data.
